clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Length Gain Between Square Flap and Z-plasty in Post Burn Contracture Release
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Length Gain Between Square Flap and Z-plasty in Post Burn Contracture Release

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of this study is to compare the gain in length after postburn contracture release using two different techniques, the more commonly practised z - plasty and relatively newer technique, square flap

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are assigned to one of two or more groups in parallel for the duration of the study

primary_outcome.description: calculation of the gain in length achieved after the release of post burn contrature

arm_group.description: Z-plasty: It will be defined as a local transposition flap that will be used to improve the functional and cosmetic appearance of scars. It will be involved creating two triangular flaps of equal dimensions that will be transposed.

Square flap: It will be defined as is another local transposition flap which will be used for release of contractures. Square will be marked on one side of the contracture, and two triangles will be marked on the other side, with the length of all the flaps equal, which will be then transposed.
